Here's the thing: 1) The DAPL is not on Native land. 2) The DAPL identified all sacred sites and has avoided them. 3) The DAPL is actually running parallel to already existing pipelines, it can simply hold more volume and the new methods applied to its construction will ensure much fewer leaks and (should such a leak even occur) would allow faster response time making it overall better for the environment and the people protesting it than that which is currently there. 4th and most important) The DAPL held an open court with advanced notice to allow legal objection by the people of Standing Rock, who chose NOT to challenge the pipeline in the court of law, but instead in the court of public opinion, resulting in what suffering they've caused themselves as a result of their illegal activities against the DAPL and Army Corps of Engineers. While I respect the Native peoples and personally hold the belief that more land should be returned to them, the fact remains that they intentionally chose to challenge the DAPL through lies and manipulation rather then take the opportunity to meet them in court when offered.

And """"nothing wrong""""? They supported the boys going on this trip, they supported their licenses and going out on their own. No beacon, no adult on the open water. Would you allow two 14 year old kids to drive from Miami to Tallahassee alone? But that's right, I forgot. If they were to break down driving there would be people nearby. I'm guessing you don't have kids or have never been around 14 year old kids, otherwise you would know how ignorant and blind are your comments. But that's your opinion and this is mine, so I won't shut up. So have a nice day.

I agree with you. Whether or not it is """"common"""" for teens to go out in boats unsupervised is irrelevant. Just because something is """"common"""" doesn't make it right. It is """"common"""" for some people to not buckle their children in the car. My ex husband did not buckle our two children on multiple occasions. My daughter died because of his negligence. These parents are learning the hardest way possible. YOU are responsible for the safety and welfare of your children until they reach 18. I pray they are found.
